Criterion: Reward for accurately documenting the semaglutide refill barrier, including pharmacy block, clinician's urgent prior authorization fax, confirmation of one unused pen remaining, and the seven-day buffer while awaiting insurance approval
Rationale: Includes pharmacy block reason and urgent prior-auth fax but omits note of one unused pen and the 7-day buffer.

Criterion: Reward for capturing the lisinopril adherence discussion: reduced dose to 10 mg once daily, shared-shelf mix-ups, instruction to label the blue-numbered blister pack with patient initials
Rationale: Documents reduced lisinopril dose to 10 mg daily but omits shared-shelf mix-up details and labeling instructions.

Criterion: Reward for recording the patient's shoulder soreness after injection and the clinician's advice to ice for ten minutes and rotate injection sites to the abdomen next time
Rationale: Records shoulder soreness advice: ice 10 min and rotate to abdomen; essentially complete.

Criterion: Reward for noting the patient's living situation (halfway house) and related medication storage challenges as expressed in the encounter
Rationale: No mention of halfway-house living situation or storage challenges.

Criterion: Reward for including current medication names and dosages from the chart only when they match the transcript (semaglutide weekly, lisinopril 10 mg daily) and omitting unrelated chart details
Rationale: Lists only semaglutide weekly and lisinopril 10 mg, matching transcript and adds no unrelated meds.

Criterion: Reward for overall completeness: the note should comprehensively reflect all clinically relevant statements and instructions present in the transcript without substantive omissions
Rationale: Note captures several key points but misses living situation and some medication adherence details, so moderately incomplete.

Criterion: Penalize for omitting any major item from the encounter such as the semaglutide prior-auth plan, lisinopril dosing/labeling instructions, or injection-site care advice
Rationale: Major omission of lisinopril labeling instructions and living-situation context triggers penalty.

Criterion: Penalize for fabricating or importing clinical content not present or implied in the transcript or chart (e.g., new diagnoses, lab orders, lifestyle counseling not discussed)
Rationale: No fabricated diagnoses or instructions beyond transcript content.

Criterion: Penalize for incorrectly stating medication dosages, frequencies, or timelines compared with what was said (e.g., recording lisinopril 20 mg or semaglutide used twice weekly)
Rationale: Medication doses and frequencies recorded accurately; no discrepancies detected.

Criterion: Penalize for indiscriminate copying of irrelevant chart information such as unrelated conditions, goals, or template sections that were not referenced in the transcript
Rationale: Does not copy irrelevant chart sections or unrelated conditions.
